meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a diploid cell or organism.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the diploidic cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The diploidic organism inherited genes from both its mother and father.
meanings.sent3: The diploidic cells threw a party to celebrate their genetic diversity.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was as diploidic as a canvas painted by two artists at once.
meanings.sent5: The diploidic nature of the organism made it resilient to environmental changes.

meanings.definition: Having two sets of chromosomes, one from each parent.
meanings.sent1: The diploidic chromosomes combined to form a complete genetic blueprint.
meanings.sent2: Each diploidic cell contains a set of chromosomes from both the mother and father.
meanings.sent3: The diploidic chromosomes played tug-of-war during cell division.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like diploidic gems reflecting the colors of her parents' chromosomes.
meanings.sent5: The diploidic inheritance ensured a diverse genetic makeup for the offspring.
